item.title: 微软在审查后禁用对以色列国防部门的服务
item.description: 微软周四表示，在内部审查发现初步证据支持加沙和约旦河西岸监控系统的媒体报道后，微软禁用了以色列国防部（IMOD）下属单位使用的一套云计算和人工智能服务。【原文：Microsoft on Thursday said it disabled a set of cloud and AI services used by a unit within the Israel Ministry of Defense (IMOD) after an internal review found preliminary evidence supporting media reports of a surveillance system in Gaza and West Bank.】

item.title: 俄罗斯预计汽车报废费收入将增加，尽管销量有所下降
item.description: 路透社查阅的一份文件显示，尽管汽车销量急剧下降，但俄罗斯政府预计今明两年来自汽车报废费的预算收入将大幅增加。【原文：The Russian government expects budget revenues from car scrappage fees to rise sharply this year and next, even though vehicle sales are in steep decline, a document reviewed by Reuters shows.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼表示，监管机构将在 2026 年初公布巴塞尔资本协议重修规则
item.description: 美联储最高监管官员周四表示，银行机构准备在 2025 年底或 2026 年初公布更有利于行业的有争议资本规则版本，即 "巴塞尔协议 III 终局"。【原文：The Federal Reserve's top regulatory official said Thursday that bank agencies are poised to unveil a more industry-friendly version of contentious capital rules known as "Basel III Endgame" by the end of 2025 or early 2026.】

item.title: 亚马逊将支付 25 亿美元和解 Prime 欺骗指控
item.description: 美国联邦贸易委员会（FTC）周四表示，亚马逊公司将向 Prime 用户支付 25 亿美元的罚款和赔偿金，以了结该委员会指控亚马逊这一零售巨头在未征得用户同意的情况下为其注册并使其难以取消的案件。【原文：Amazon.com will pay $2.5 billion in fines and redress to Prime subscribers to settle the U.S. Federal Trade Commission's case alleging the retail juggernaut signed users up for the subscription without their consent and made it difficult to cancel, the FTC said on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，谷歌很可能被处以第二张欧盟反垄断罚单
item.description: 三位直接了解此事的人士说，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌很可能在未来几个月内被处以具有里程碑意义的欧盟科技规则规定的第二张罚单，欧盟委员会目前正在起草相关决定。【原文：Alphabet's Google is likely to be hit with its second fine under landmark EU tech rules in the coming months, and the European Commission is now drafting its decision, three people with direct knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 特朗普政府启动进口调查，美国医疗科技股下跌
item.description: 美国商务部对进口医疗器械展开调查后，美国医疗科技股周四下跌，此举最终可能导致关税。【原文：U.S. medtech stocks fell on Thursday after the U.S. Commerce Department opened a probe into imports of medical devices, a move that could ultimately lead to tariffs.】

item.title: 中国调查美墨山核桃进口，墨西哥采取限制措施
item.description: 中国商务部周四对从美国和墨西哥进口的山核桃发起反倾销调查，这表明全球贸易关系更加紧张，与这两个北美国家的摩擦也在增加。【原文：China's commerce ministry initiated an anti-dumping investigation into pecans imported from the United States and Mexico on Thursday, signalling more global trade tensions and increased friction with the two northern American nations.】

item.title: 研究人员称，Instagram 的青少年安全功能存在缺陷
item.description: 据儿童安全倡导组织的一份报告称，多年来 Meta 为保护 Instagram 上的年轻用户而实施的许多安全功能并不能很好地发挥作用，或者在某些情况下根本不存在，东北大学的研究人员也证实了这一点。【原文：Numerous safety features that Meta has said it has implemented to protect young users on Instagram over the years do not work well or, in some cases, don't exist, according to a report from child-safety advocacy groups that was corroborated by researchers at Northeastern University.】

item.title: 泽连斯基向美国企业示好，寻求发展乌克兰无人机产业
item.description: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）的办公室周四表示，乌克兰总统在会见一系列美国领先企业的高层管理人员时概述了乌克兰促进无人机出口和扩大技术合作的计划。【原文：President Volodymyr Zelenskiy outlined Ukraine's plans to boost drone exports and expand tech partnerships as he met the top management of a host of leading U.S. businesses, his office said on Thursday.】

item.title: 捷豹路虎称网络攻击后部分系统已恢复运行
item.description: 汽车制造商捷豹路虎周四表示，在最近的一次网络攻击导致其在英国的业务瘫痪后，其部分数字系统已重新上线。【原文：Carmaker Jaguar Land Rover said on Thursday some of its digital systems were back online following a recent cyber attack that has crippled its operations in Britain.】

item.title: 微软合并面向企业的人工智能应用商店
item.description: 微软公司周四表示，已将面向企业的人工智能工具的独立市场合并为一个产品。【原文：Microsoft has combined the separate marketplaces for its artificial intelligence tools aimed at businesses into one offering, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 马斯克的 xAI 将为美国联邦机构提供 Grok 聊天机器人
item.description: 美国政府采购部门周四表示，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的xAI公司已与美国总务管理局（GSA）达成协议，将向联邦机构提供这家人工智能初创公司的Grok聊天机器人。【原文：Elon Musk's xAI has struck a deal with the U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) to provide the artificial intelligence startup's Grok chatbot to federal agencies, the government's procurement arm said on Thursday.】

item.title: CloudHQ 将投资 48 亿美元建设墨西哥数据中心
item.description: 美国科技公司 CloudHQ 的一位高管周四表示，该公司未来几年将投资 48 亿美元在墨西哥中部克雷塔罗州建设六个数据中心，并称这些数据中心将用于云计算和人工智能。【原文：U.S. tech firm CloudHQ will invest $4.8 billion in a project to build six data centers in Mexico's central Queretaro state over the coming years, a company executive said on Thursday, adding these would be used to fuel cloud computing and artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 美国 8 月成屋销售下滑
item.description: 由于市场上的房屋价格仍然昂贵，购房者的负担能力存在问题，而且尽管近期借贷成本下降，但抵押贷款利率仍然相对较高，因此8月份美国旧房销售量出现下滑。【原文：Sales of previously owned U.S. homes ticked lower in August amid affordability issues for buyers thanks to still-pricey homes on the market and interest rates on mortgages that remain relatively steep despite recent drops in borrowing costs.】

item.title: 美国和欧洲消费放缓，H&M 瞄准巴西和印度市场
item.description: 时装零售商 H&M 公司首席执行官周四表示，由于其核心地区欧洲的消费支出疲软，以及美国关税对其第二大市场的需求造成压力，H&M 公司正寻求在巴西和印度等新兴市场扩张。【原文：Fashion retailer H&M is seeking to expand in emerging markets such as Brazil and India, its CEO said on Thursday, as consumer spending weakens in Europe, its core region, and U.S. tariffs weigh on demand in its second-largest market.】

item.title: 国际金融协会称，全球债务达到创纪录的近 338 万亿美元
item.description: 周四的一份季度报告显示，受全球金融环境宽松、美元走软以及主要央行采取更加宽松的立场等因素的影响，全球债务在第二季度末创下了337.7万亿美元的历史新高。【原文：Global debt hit a record high of $337.7 trillion at the end of the second quarter, driven by easing global financial conditions, a softer U.S. dollar and a more accommodative stance from major central banks, a quarterly report showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 独家报道--拉塔姆开发银行计划未来五年为儿童投资 50 亿美元
item.description: 这是一条突发新闻。全面报道将很快发布。【原文：This is a breaking news story. Full coverage will be available soon.】

item.title: 马斯克的 xAI 指责竞争对手 OpenAI 窃取商业机密
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的人工智能初创公司xAI在加利福尼亚州联邦法院起诉竞争对手OpenAI，指控后者窃取其商业机密，从而在人工智能技术开发竞赛中获得不公平优势。【原文：Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup xAI has sued rival OpenAI in California federal court for allegedly stealing its trade secrets to gain an unfair advantage in the race to develop AI technology.】

item.title: 谷歌请求美国最高法院冻结 Epic Games 案中的应用商店禁令
item.description: Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司（Google）表示，它已敦促美国最高法院停止执行一项法官命令的关键部分，该命令将迫使谷歌对其应用程序商店 Play 做出重大修改，因为谷歌正准备就《堡垒之夜》（Fortnite）制作商 Epic Games 提起的诉讼中的一项裁决提起上诉。【原文：Alphabet's Google said it has urged the U.S. Supreme Court to halt key parts of a judge's order that would force major changes to its app store Play, as it prepares to appeal a decision in a lawsuit brought by "Fortnite" maker Epic Games.】

item.title: 美国 8 月份核心资本货物订单意外增长
item.description: 8 月份，美国主要制成品资本货物的新订单出人意料地增加，但这些货物的出货量下降，表明本季度企业设备支出的增长速度温和。【原文：New orders for key U.S.-manufactured capital goods unexpectedly increased in August, but a decline in shipments of these goods suggested a moderate pace of growth in business spending on equipment this quarter.】

item.title: Databricks 与 OpenAI 合作为企业客户提供人工智能模型
item.description: 分析公司 Databricks 周四表示，它已与 OpenAI 合作，将 ChatGPT 制造商的人工智能模型集成到其面向企业客户的平台中。【原文：Analytics firm Databricks said on Thursday it has partnered with OpenAI to integrate the ChatGPT maker's artificial intelligence models into its platforms for enterprise customers.】

item.title: 美联储施密德：目前美联储已接近完成任务，但政策必须向前看。
item.description: 这是一条突发新闻。全面报道将很快发布。【原文：This is a breaking news story. Full coverage will be available soon.】

item.title: 独家报道CoreWeave 签订 65 亿美元新合同，扩大与 OpenAI 的协议范围
item.description: 人工智能云提供商 CoreWeave 扩大了与 OpenAI 的合作关系，达成了一项价值高达 65 亿美元的新协议，使双方协议的总价值达到 224 亿美元，这是 OpenAI 为确保计算能力而签署的一系列十亿美元交易中的最新一笔。【原文：AI cloud provider CoreWeave has expanded its partnership with OpenAI in a new deal worth up to $6.5 billion, bringing the total value of their agreements to $22.4 billion, the latest in a series of billion-dollar deals OpenAI has signed to secure computational power.】

item.title: 美国第二季度国内生产总值增长大幅上调
item.description: 受进口下降和消费支出回升的推动，美国经济在第二季度的增长速度超过了此前的预期，但此后增长势头似乎有所放缓。【原文：The U.S. economy grew faster than previously thought in the second quarter, pumped up by an ebb in imports and a pickup in consumer spending, but momentum appears to have since slowed.】

item.title: 美国 8 月商品贸易逆差大幅缩减
item.description: 政府数据显示，由于进口急剧下降，8月份美国货物贸易逆差大幅收缩。【原文：The U.S. trade deficit in goods contracted sharply in August amid a plunge in imports, government data showed.】

item.title: 消息人士称，沙特 PIF 控股的 AviLease 考虑发行首次债券
item.description: 两位知情人士告诉路透社记者，由沙特阿拉伯近 1 万亿美元的公共投资基金（PIF）支持的飞机租赁公司 AviLease 一直在与银行进行谈判，为首次债券销售做准备。【原文：AviLease, a jet-leasing firm backed by Saudi Arabia's almost $1 trillion Public Investment Fund (PIF), has been holding talks with banks to prepare an inaugural bond sale, two people with knowledge of the plan told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国每周申请失业救济人数下降，但劳动力市场趋软
item.description: 上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数有所下降，但劳动力市场在招聘步伐疲软的情况下已失去光泽。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell last week, but the labor market has lost its luster amid an anemic pace of hiring.】

item.title: 捷普预测全年业绩乐观，因人工智能驱动数据中心需求增长
item.description: 捷普公司周四预测，2026 财年的利润和收入将高于华尔街的预期，因为这家电子元件制造商寄希望于人工智能推动的数据中心繁荣。【原文：Jabil forecast profit and revenue for the fiscal year 2026 above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, as the electronics component maker banks on an artificial intelligence-driven boom for data centers.】

item.title: 亚马逊的杂货野心在英国受挫
item.description: 当亚马逊于 2021 年在美国以外开设第一家杂货店时，它选择在伦敦西部开设一家无收银员商店，这被视为是向英国价值 2900 亿美元的食品市场发起重大冲击的开始。【原文：When Amazon opened its first grocery store outside the United States in 2021, its choice of a site in west London for a cashier-free store was seen as the start of a major assault on Britain’s $290 billion food market.】

item.title: 雪佛龙预计赫斯交易将带来高达 4 亿美元的季度影响
item.description: 雪佛龙公司周四表示，由于收购赫斯公司的影响，预计第三季度将亏损 2 亿至 4 亿美元。【原文：Chevron said on Thursday it was expecting a loss of $200 million to $400 million in the third quarter due to the impact related to the acquisition of Hess.】
